intro: Lagotis yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan lagotis, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with a fine, hairy texture, while its stems are sturdy and often branched. Lagotis yunnanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential medicinal properties.
